venue.address_1: 105 Atlantic and Richmond, Aquarium Boston, MA, 02103 - 617-635-3607
venue.name: Christopher Columbus Waterfront Park

item.description:
On Sept. 24, on the streets of Boston, join a worldwide event, Moving Planet, to call on our elected leaders, businesses and communities to get serious about moving beyond fossil fuels.  Stand up for clean air and a stable climate!  Send a message to elected leaders: we will hold you accountable for moving us away from fossil fuels and toward a clean energy future.

Come on bike or on foot, by boat, wheelchair, carpool or public transportation!  Come with your community, your organization, or simply yourself to help make one big, bold, beautiful statement:

We have the power to build a secure, healthy, just and sustainable future for our children and our planet!

LATEST NEWS

  • Steve Curwood, Executive Producer and Host of Living on Earth, will emcee the rally!  Living on Earth airs on more than 270 public radio stations in the USA.  Steve has been a journalist for more than 30 years with experience at NPR, CBS News, the Boston Globe, WBUR-FM/Boston and WGBH-TV/Boston.  He shared the 1975 Pulitzer Prize for Public Service as part of the Boston Globe’s education team.  He is also the recipient of the 2003 Global Green Award for Media Design, the 2003 David A. Brower Award from the Sierra Club for excellence in environmental reporting, and the 1992 New England Environmental Leadership Award from Tufts University for his work on promoting environmental awareness.
  • Two volunteer trainings are coming up!  Join us Sunday 9/18, 3-5pm at Northeastern University’s Curry Student Center (building 50) room 346 on Huntington Ave., Boston, MA or Tuesday, 9/20, 7-9pm at the Harvard Epworth Methodist Church, 1555 Massachusetts Avenue, Cambridge, MA (Harvard Square).  We still need plenty of parade marshals, help with orienting people, and help with setup and breakdown of the rally.  Email MovingNewEngland@gmail.com to let us know what you’d like to help with.
  • Art Parties!  Come make Moving Planet related art:
    • Sunday, September 18th, 2-7pm at Spontaneous Celebrations, 45 Danforth St (right by Stonybrook Station). Contact Ninya for more details:ninya.loeppky@gmail.com
    • Tuesday, September 20th, after school at Boston Latin School, 78 Avenue Louis Pasteur, Boston, MA. Time TBA. This is an art party for youth and youth groups only.
    • Wednesday, September 21st, 4-7pm at First Baptist Church, 633 Centre Street, Jamaica Plain. This is an outdoor art party on the lawn and will be canceled in case of rain. Artwork can be stored at the church to dry.
    • Thursday, September 22nd, 11am-1pm in the Multipurpose Room at 450 Washington St. in Dorchester.  The group coming from Dorchester with the Dorchester Environmental Health Coalition and DotBikes will host.  Everyone is welcome to join!  Materials will be provided, but feel free to bring your own markers, fabric, cardboard, etc.  Contact Sarah atsarah.cadorette@gmail.com for more information.

9/24 SCHEDULE (RAIN OR SHINE)

  • Before the event: Move Your Community from around New England to Boston.
  • 3-3:45pm: Rolling parades to the Columbus Park rally, departing from North Station, South Station, Park Street Station, and Long Wharf North (near the ferry ticket area).  Check in with parade marshals who will direct groups of 25 or more to the rally.
  • 3:50-6pm: Rally for Solutions at Columbus Waterfront Park (Aquarium T).  New England will join the rest of the world in a peaceful, festive rally calling on leaders at all levels to take action to speed the transition away from fossil fuels.
    • Display your efforts and vision! Share with the world what you are doing to reduce reliance on fossil fuels and express your vision of a fossil-fuel free future.  Get creative to make this a festive event!  Bring banners, dress up, make puppets, floats, images, & chants to reflect how you contribute to this movement.
    • For more details about the rally, see 9/24 Schedule.
item.how_to_find_us: Christopher Columbus Park is at Atlantic and Richmond, Boston, MA, 02103 - 617-635-3607
